segment.source: Control Microsoft Passport settings on devices with Microsoft Intune
segment.target: Control Microsoft Passport settings on devices with Microsoft Intune

segment.source: Control Microsoft Passport settings on devices with Microsoft Intune
segment.target: Control Microsoft Passport settings on devices with Microsoft Intune

segment.source: lets you integrate with Microsoft Passport for Work which is an alternative sign-in method that uses Active Directory, or an Azure Active Directory account to replace a password, smart card, or virtual smart card.
segment.target: lets you integrate with Microsoft Passport for Work which is an alternative sign-in method that uses Active Directory, or an Azure Active Directory account to replace a password, smart card, or virtual smart card.

segment.source: Passport lets you use a user gesture to login, instead of a password.
segment.target: Passport lets you use a user gesture to login, instead of a password.

segment.source: A user gesture might be a simple PIN, biometric authentication such as Windows Hello, or an external device such as a fingerprint reader.
segment.target: A user gesture might be a simple PIN, biometric authentication such as Windows Hello, or an external device such as a fingerprint reader.

segment.source: integrates with Passport for Work in two ways:
segment.target: integrates with Passport for Work in two ways:

segment.source: You can use policy to control which gestures users can and cannot use to login
segment.target: You can use policy to control which gestures users can and cannot use to login

segment.source: You can store authentication certificates in the Passport for Work key storage provider (KSP).
segment.target: You can store authentication certificates in the Passport for Work key storage provider (KSP).

segment.source: For more information, see Enable access to company resources using certificate profiles with Microsoft Intune.
segment.target: For more information, see Enable access to company resources using certificate profiles with Microsoft Intune.

segment.source: To create a Passport for Work policy
segment.target: To create a Passport for Work policy

segment.source: In the Microsoft Intune administration console, click Admin > Mobile Device Management > Windows > Passport for Work.
segment.target: In the Microsoft Intune administration console, click Admin > Mobile Device Management > Windows > Passport for Work.

segment.source: Choose from the following values that will affect all enrolled Windows 10 and Windows 10 Mobile devices:
segment.target: Choose from the following values that will affect all enrolled Windows 10 and Windows 10 Mobile devices:

segment.source: Setting
segment.target: Setting

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: - Disable Passport for Work on enrolled devices
segment.target: - Disable Passport for Work on enrolled devices

segment.source: - Enable Passport for Work on enrolled devices
segment.target: - Enable Passport for Work on enrolled devices

segment.source: Enables or disables the use of Passport for work on all enrolled Windows 10 and Windows 10 mobile devices.
segment.target: Enables or disables the use of Passport for work on all enrolled Windows 10 and Windows 10 mobile devices.

segment.source: Important: This policy is enabled by default and applied to all Windows 10 devices when they enroll.
segment.target: Important: This policy is enabled by default and applied to all Windows 10 devices when they enroll.

segment.source: Use a Trusted Platform Module (TPM)
segment.target: Use a Trusted Platform Module (TPM)

segment.source: A Trusted Platform Module (TPM) chip provides an additional layer of data security.
segment.target: A Trusted Platform Module (TPM) chip provides an additional layer of data security.

segment.source: Choose one of the following values:
segment.target: Choose one of the following values:

segment.source: - Required (default) - Only devices with an accessible TPM can provision Passport for Work.
segment.target: - Required (default) - Only devices with an accessible TPM can provision Passport for Work.

segment.source: - Preferred - Devices first attempt to use a TPM.
segment.target: - Preferred - Devices first attempt to use a TPM.

segment.source: If this is not available, they can use software encryption
segment.target: If this is not available, they can use software encryption

segment.source: Require minimum PIN length
segment.target: Require minimum PIN length

segment.source: Specify the minimum number of characters required for the Passport for Work PIN.
segment.target: Specify the minimum number of characters required for the Passport for Work PIN.

segment.source: You must use at least 4 characters (the default value is 6 characters).
segment.target: You must use at least 4 characters (the default value is 6 characters).

segment.source: Require maximum PIN length
segment.target: Require maximum PIN length

segment.source: Specify the maximum number of characters allowed for the Passport for Work PIN.
segment.target: Specify the maximum number of characters allowed for the Passport for Work PIN.

segment.source: You can use up to 127 characters.
segment.target: You can use up to 127 characters.

segment.source: Require lowercase letters in PIN
segment.target: Require lowercase letters in PIN

segment.source: Specifies whether lowercase letters must be used in the Passport for Work PIN.
segment.target: Specifies whether lowercase letters must be used in the Passport for Work PIN.

segment.source: Choose from:
segment.target: Choose from:

segment.source: - Allowed - Users can use lowercase characters in their PIN.
segment.target: - Allowed - Users can use lowercase characters in their PIN.

segment.source: - Required - Users must include at least one lowercase character in their PIN.
segment.target: - Required - Users must include at least one lowercase character in their PIN.

segment.source: - Not allowed (default) - Users must not use lowercase characters in their PIN.
segment.target: - Not allowed (default) - Users must not use lowercase characters in their PIN.

segment.source: Require uppercase letters in PIN
segment.target: Require uppercase letters in PIN

segment.source: Specifies whether uppercase letters must be used in the Passport for Work PIN.
segment.target: Specifies whether uppercase letters must be used in the Passport for Work PIN.

segment.source: Choose from:
segment.target: Choose from:

segment.source: - Allowed - Users can use uppercase characters in their PIN.
segment.target: - Allowed - Users can use uppercase characters in their PIN.

segment.source: - Required - Users must include at least one uppercase character in their PIN.
segment.target: - Required - Users must include at least one uppercase character in their PIN.

segment.source: - Not allowed (default) - Users must not use uppercase characters in their PIN.
segment.target: - Not allowed (default) - Users must not use uppercase characters in their PIN.

segment.source: Require special characters in PIN
segment.target: Require special characters in PIN

segment.source: Specifies the use of special characters in the PIN.
segment.target: Specifies the use of special characters in the PIN.

segment.source: Choose from:
segment.target: Choose from:

segment.source: - Allowed - Users can use special characters in their PIN.
segment.target: - Allowed - Users can use special characters in their PIN.

segment.source: - Required - Users must include at least one special character in their PIN.
segment.target: - Required - Users must include at least one special character in their PIN.

segment.source: - Not allowed (default) - Users must not use special characters in their PIN (this is also the behavior if the setting is not configured).
segment.target: - Not allowed (default) - Users must not use special characters in their PIN (this is also the behavior if the setting is not configured).

segment.source: PIN expiration (days)
segment.target: PIN expiration (days)

segment.source: Specifies the number of days before the device PIN must be changed.
segment.target: Specifies the number of days before the device PIN must be changed.

segment.source: The default is 41 days.
segment.target: The default is 41 days.

segment.source: Remember PIN history
segment.target: Remember PIN history

segment.source: Use this setting to restrict the re-use of previously used PINS.
segment.target: Use this setting to restrict the re-use of previously used PINS.

segment.source: The default is the last 5 PINS used cannot be reused.
segment.target: The default is the last 5 PINS used cannot be reused.

segment.source: Allow biometric authentication
segment.target: Allow biometric authentication

segment.source: Enables biometric authentication such as facial recognition or fingerprint as an alternative to a PIN for Passport for Work.
segment.target: Enables biometric authentication such as facial recognition or fingerprint as an alternative to a PIN for Passport for Work.

segment.source: Users must still configure a work PIN in case biometric authentication fails.
segment.target: Users must still configure a work PIN in case biometric authentication fails.

segment.source: If set to Yes, Passport for Work allows biometric authentication.
segment.target: If set to Yes, Passport for Work allows biometric authentication.

segment.source: If set to No, Passport for Work prevents biometric authentication (for all account types).
segment.target: If set to No, Passport for Work prevents biometric authentication (for all account types).

segment.source: Use enhanced anti-spoofing, when available
segment.target: Use enhanced anti-spoofing, when available

segment.source: Configures whether enhanced anti-spoofing is used on devices that support it.
segment.target: Configures whether enhanced anti-spoofing is used on devices that support it.

segment.source: If set to Yes, Windows requires all users to use anti-spoofing for facial features when supported.
segment.target: If set to Yes, Windows requires all users to use anti-spoofing for facial features when supported.

segment.source: Use Remote Passport
segment.target: Use Remote Passport

segment.source: If this option is set to Yes, users can use a remote passport to serve as a portable companion device for desktop computer authentication.
segment.target: If this option is set to Yes, users can use a remote passport to serve as a portable companion device for desktop computer authentication.

segment.source: The desktop computer must be Azure Active Directory joined, and the companion device must be configured with a Passport for Work PIN.
segment.target: The desktop computer must be Azure Active Directory joined, and the companion device must be configured with a Passport for Work PIN.

segment.source: When you are finished, click Save.
segment.target: When you are finished, click Save.

segment.source: Further information
segment.target: Further information

segment.source: For more information about Microsoft Passport, see Microsoft Passport guide in the Windows 10 documentation.
segment.target: For more information about Microsoft Passport, see Microsoft Passport guide in the Windows 10 documentation.

segment.source: See Also
segment.target: See Also

segment.source: Protect data and devices with Microsoft Intune
segment.target: Protect data and devices with Microsoft Intune
